thread.title: DMK takes TN trust vote issue to Madras high court
thread.title_full: DMK takes TN trust vote issue to Madras high court

author: A Subramani
title: DMK takes TN trust vote issue to Madras high court
text:
CHENNAI: Two days after Tamil Nadu assembly expressed confidence in the Edappadi K Palaniswami government amidst ruckus created by the DMK after Speaker P Dhanapal refused secret ballot, the party on Monday took the issue to the Madras high court . 

Soon after the court assembled on Monday morning, senior advocate and former DMK Rajya Sabha member R Shanmugasundaram mentioned the matter before the first bench and sought urgent hearing. 

The bench of acting Chief Justice Huluvadi G Ramesh and Justice R Mahadevan asked him to file the petition, so that it could be heard on Tuesday. 

So now it has become clear that the first of the PILs bringing the Tamil Nadu assembly proceedings on Saturday under judicial scrutiny will be taken up for hearing on Tuesday. 

Among other things, the party is expected to seek declaration of the vote count as null and void, and order fresh voting under secret ballot system. 

An MLA from the rebel AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam faction is readying a similar petition to be filed in court. The OPS faction's earlier bid to move an urgent house motion before a judge during the weekend did not succeed, since the acting chief justice was away.
